channel.title: Can any Companies make a decent product anymore?
channel.description:
Well to begin with my families house is about 10 years old and its in a pretty nice neighborhood. Every major applicance has gone out since we have bought it and we have replaced all of these, this includes:
Heat Pump Dishwasher Stove Built-in Refridarator Water Heater About every water faucet
For the record we treat all of our appliances nicely (including wiping off all of the dishes before we put them in the dishwasher and cleaning them regularly).
Today the shower faucet broke (delta piece of shit) never buy a faucet branded delta unless you want leaky fauces that area POS Also today THE 3 YEAR OLD DISHWASHER KITCHENAID broke a water control valve cracked on it. All of these are American products and ALL OF THEM SUCK MAJOR DICK.
So the question is can American companies make any decent fucking product anymore? My grandparents said that their used to be refrigerators that would last 50 years and now the quality of products has all gone to shit.

item.title: Can any Companies make a decent product anymore?
item.dc:creator: @antiyou antiyou
item.description:
@antiyou wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:42, topic:337361”][quote author=the bank link=topic=433763.msg3190173#msg3190173 date=1272164261]
I hate fucking birds.
[/quote]
me too. their feathers always get in the way.[/quote]

Thats why you stick with the bald eagle.

Read full topic

item.source: Can any Companies make a decent product anymore?

item.title: Can any Companies make a decent product anymore?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“repacsenur, post:33, topic:337361”]newer things are designed to work until your warranty runs out so you buy a new tv/computer etc. This way they will stay in business. I ain’t kidding I had a coffee maker that worked exactly to the date when the warranty just ran out without extensions of course never buy them they are a ripoff.

But yah i unscrewed the coffee maker had no burnt metal checked the resistance with a volt meter seems none of the wires fried it was all clean like factory clean no water nothing very good seal… So obviously had a internal clock that kept it running until a certain date…

Thing is it powers up like nothing is broken but when you try to use any buttons like clean/delay/brew now etc they didn’t respond obvious something wrong with the on-board microchip.

Not saying all company’s make rigged products but if you buy a coffee maker from MR.COFFEE then it will happen to you too.[/quote]

your diagnostic skills suck ass

Read full topic
item.source: Can any Companies make a decent product anymore?

item.title: Can any Companies make a decent product anymore?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

repacsenur:

LOL you expect me to buy some kind of chemical to clean the chip so you can access it then use a microscope and some little tweezers to try to find some way of accessing the chip not to mention the learning curve required to know what the hell you’re doing without frying the little chip with high amperage.

loool u trollin bro?

Read full topic
item.source: Can any Companies make a decent product anymore?

item.source: Can any Companies make a decent product anymore?

item.title: Can any Companies make a decent product anymore?
item.dc:creator: @repacsenur repacsenur
item.description:
@repacsenur wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:35, topic:337361”][quote author=repacsenur link=topic=433763.msg3189277#msg3189277 date=1272086273]
But yah i unscrewed the coffee maker had no burnt metal checked the resistance with a volt meter seems none of the wires fried it was all clean like factory clean no water nothing very good seal… So obviously had a internal clock that kept it running until a certain date…
[/quote]
I don’t think that’s a very logical conclusion.[/quote]

the microchip is protected with some kind of black harden molten plastic laminated the chip or i dont know what it is but the chip is protected and it’s not like I took the coffee maker and tossed it on the floor it had no damages but yes i guess it’s possible some leads i haven’t seen got rusty or burnt i don’t know all I know is that it powers up and everything works the clock works only the buttons if you press them they do nothing and the leads to the buttons etc are soldered and nothing wrong there (remember it used to work before for a few years).

But why am i even talking about it i tossed it into the trash a month ago it was in mint condition other then some dust.

LOL you expect me to buy some kind of chemical to clean the chip so you can access it then use a microscope and some little tweezers to try to find some way of accessing the chip not to mention the learning curve required to know what the hell you’re doing without frying the little chip with high amperage.

Read full topic

item.title: Can any Companies make a decent product anymore?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“repacsenur, post:33, topic:337361”]But yah i unscrewed the coffee maker had no burnt metal checked the resistance with a volt meter seems none of the wires fried it was all clean like factory clean no water nothing very good seal… So obviously had a internal clock that kept it running until a certain date…

Thing is it powers up like nothing is broken but when you try to use any buttons like clean/delay/brew now etc they didn’t respond obvious something wrong with the on-board microchip.[/quote]
just because the microchip failed doesn’t mean they implemented a timer. i don’t believe any company would do something like that because they’d get in so much shit if they were found out.

is it possible to reverse engineer a microchip to find out exactly how it functions? if so, you should try it.

Read full topic
item.source: Can any Companies make a decent product anymore?

item.title: Can any Companies make a decent product anymore?
item.dc:creator: @repacsenur repacsenur
item.description:
@repacsenur wrote:

newer things are designed to work until your warranty runs out so you buy a new tv/computer etc. This way they will stay in business. I ain’t kidding I had a coffee maker that worked exactly to the date when the warranty just ran out without extensions of course never buy them they are a ripoff.

But yah i unscrewed the coffee maker had no burnt metal checked the resistance with a volt meter seems none of the wires fried it was all clean like factory clean no water nothing very good seal… So obviously had a internal clock that kept it running until a certain date…

Thing is it powers up like nothing is broken but when you try to use any buttons like clean/delay/brew now etc they didn’t respond obvious something wrong with the on-board microchip.

Not saying all company’s make rigged products but if you buy a coffee maker from MR.COFFEE then it will happen to you too.

Read full topic

[/quote]
except transistors are far more reliable than vacuum tubes, and far less complex[/quote]

item.title: Can any Companies make a decent product anymore?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

You do understand that with advancements in technology, there’s a lot more room for error. Things made 30 and 40 years ago were made with simple parts, they didn’t have transistors, they used vacuum tubes, they didn’t have liquid crystals, they had electrons.

Read full topic
item.source: Can any Companies make a decent product anymore?

item.title: Can any Companies make a decent product anymore?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:26, topic:337361”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=433763.msg3189108#msg3189108 date=1272072198]

Sony makes good computers/televisions.

No my TV which I bought were we used to live has gone out also after only a couple years, but we were planning on getting a LCD anyway so it worked out ok even though it would have been nice to have an extra tv. We are buying samsung this time. Also sony sucks at making computers, I build my own anyways. I feel like im getting fucked in the ass with problems everyday. I may be the most unlucky person ever.
[/quote]
You seem to have problems with a lot of things :
I have a sony tv from the early 80s that still works nearly perfectly, and another from the 80s as well that worked up until 2-3 years ago.[/quote]

Yes exactly see what im saying all newer products suck dick. My sister has a smaller sony tv in her from from the 1990’s and it works perfect so I see there and my grandparents have a bunch of sony lcds around their house with no problems yet but we bought this one about 3 years ago and it just shit on us I think it was the tube or something. Before that we had a Mitsubishi television which lasted a really long time.

Read full topic
